review: Average I suppose. As a TGIFs in general I would rate this one more of a D+.  When i dropped my napkin, instead of getting me a new one, they put it back next to me on the table. Really?  Anyway, the pork ribs are very tender n good. Shrimp is ok, spinach dip is ok.  It's just all OK

In a strange Location from RT 4 You see the sign that says for lease and then the Fridays sign. This is mis leading I think everyone thinks its shut atleast I did till today but its very well not.    Went for lunch with a large group that had reservations. The waiters and greeters treated us like we where a forighn group like they never saw a large group. They then tried to squeeze us in when the resturant was empty. After talking with someone we fixed that. We then order and it took nearly an hour for some of the dishes to come while others where done.  The menu is great and is better I find then a few years ago more selection and better quality food. The moral of this review is the SERVICE SUCKS AND IF YOU GO HOPE YOU HAVE ALOT OF PATIENCE cause 1 wait staff for a large group is OBSERD!

Gee, I guess I got lucky coming here and having a decent meal...  it was at opening for lunch; server was Jeremy; got a big salad...weird, old-looking mini carrots on the salad, but otherwise a beautiful salad that tasted fresh.  The avocado vinaigrette had a bit of a Mexican spice flavor.  Jeremy was a fabulous server---very attentive and friendly.  Just got an iced tea to drink.  All was great for the most part.  Sorry to read so many less than desirable reviews.

I am a big TGI Friday's fan but lets just say today was a great experience. Usually when I go in I don't interact much with the bartenders but on this day I had a great time. I decided to hit up the bar before classes started and had myself a pink punk cosmo, 2 apple martinis, 2 malibu bay breezes, and a TGI Friday's chicken sandwich. Everything was to perfection and my bartender, Dan, was excellent. He and the hostess (whose name I never caught) had me in stitches with jokes about Lady Gaga, Cher, Madonna, and us just interacting was great. Why do I like this place? Because it is conveniently located right down from the school I attend and the pricing isn't half bad. I find the service tends to leave much to be desired, but on this day it changed my mind. I usually hit this place up before 6 pm any given day of the week and so it's never crowded at the bar. The food is always on point and my orders very rarely need to be sent back or to be taken again. Overall, I am a satisfied customers with no complaint Here is a tip: Try the pink punk cosmo it has cotton candy in it LOL

Eh, this is your regular Fridays. Very weird location which most people would not be able to find for the first time. Don't expect much. The bar staff is good, and most do make a very nice strong LIT, cap and cokes, etc. However DO NOT get any of the domestics here, for some reason they are ALWAYS flat and look like apple juice. Happy hour appetizers are decent if your in for a cheap little meal.

One of the best experiences I have ever had at this restaurant. I was starving coming in and more than satisfied walking out. Our waiter, Angel, was one of the best waiters I have ever had. He gave great recommendations on our meals and didn't even bother to ask if I wanted another glass of water, he had it right there ready for me as soon as I finished. The food was amazing. I would Definitely go back again.

I do like this chain, like many others- Outback, Chillis, etc. They're always available and affordable. I have been to other TGIFridays and always came out satisfied, no complaints. But this particular location, I will never return to. The service was slow, not as friendly nor respectful than I think it should have been. The food was by far the worst I've tried in this chain. My entree took about 40 minutes to come out after ordering, and it was definitely not as good as it sounded. Silverware wasn't as clean. Overall bad experience here, below average. Will not be returning.

I love it here, even though it tends to be quiet some nights I like how it is more personal and never a wait. Their food is always fresh, and drink service is always great. I never had a really bad moment here. I always go after 10 though for happy hour as I recommend the spinach dip and the long island ice teas. The bartenders are always welcoming and generous and most of all don't forget about you.

I gave it 1 star because the food was decent, yes I've had better at Tgi Friday before.. But the food here wasn't that bad. I couldn't believe how bad our service was last night, I went with 2 of my friends to eat there around 11 o'clock at night.. We were welcomed at the door and were seated immediately, place wasn't busy. Our waitress came took our drinks order and brought  the drinks after 10 minutes. Then we ordered the spinach dip to share, and that took another 20 minutes to come, we actually had to ask if our appetizer was coming.. Then she brought it after 5 minutes which makes me think she might have forgotten to put the order in. Anyway, the spin dip we had was just horrible, it's basically someone put it In the microwave and turned it on for a good ten minutes, IT WAS SO HARD and DRY.. We couldn't eat it.. Then we just kept waiting and waiting and waiting for our food while our waitress started cleaning the other tables and then moved the tables and started sweeping the floor, and I'm saying the waitress Yes.. Not the busboy or someone else.. It's the same waitress that was handling our food.  are you kidding me? finally came the food and it was like I said decent. The waitress hasn't checked on us once to see if we needed anything, she was in the back room the whole time after cleaning the floor and after we finished we had to ask the other waitress to bring us the check because we just wanted to get the heck out of this place. Our food took 40 minutes to come to the table and our waitress was so unprofessional, experience as a whole was unpleasant. Will never go back.

It's difficult to get to this place. It's off the highway and you have to cross several lanes to turn into the parking lot. The food is okay, typical Friday's stuff. Last time I went I got the ribs and they were tolerable. The service started off badly with a waitress showing up saying, "I don't know where your server is, so I guess I'll be taking care of you." She was fine for the rest of the meal, but it just seemed unorganized. There's nothing special at all about this place. If you're really hungry and in the neighborhood I guess it's fine, but planning a visit here is a waste.

Fun place, they do a bunch of events and specials through out the week. Awesome on Thursday when they have a 3$ special on drinks and appetizers. The sesame sampler is my fave along with the Jack Daniels burgers. My only complaint would be that I constantly have to ask for stronger drinks because even the LITs taste under poured. Besides that I would recommend it.

Love this TGI Fridays in particular! Atmosphere is nice and the food rocks! Don't really understand how people can even go to the Applebees across the street when there is a TGI Fridays right in front of them... Love the fried greed beans and the vanilla bean chessecake!

Came here with a large group where they would've made a decent amount of profit. Called ahead and there was no one when we arrived but still had to wait 30 minutes to be seated. Food took forever to come out. Servers where awkward. Just an overall disappointment for a nice chain restaurant.

Wait staff was ehhhh, took a while to get to our table even though it was late at night. He spilled a drink on another table, and there was a fly near our table that was annoying as F... The food is typical Fridays food, but I do enjoy it. The J Daniels is always the way to go and this time I just got the appetizer sampler with a side. Cheaper and get to try all the JD products. It's a nice last resort and I prefer it over applebees. It is hard to find, but all you have to do is take that traffic light across from the home depot area and go up the ramp to park. Then take the stairs down to the TGIF. Make sure you also check out the specials for a good deal.

This is only my 3rd time eating at a Friday's...my entire life. Thursday afternoon, we went in for an early lunch at 11am and they were renovating the bar so we all had to be seated at one location. The staff was super friendly. The food was very inexpensive and the taste and quality of the food well, there's really nothing much to say. It will satisfy your hunger and your craving for fried stuff or stuff with cheese with a side of an alcoholic drink all for under $30 for two people!!! Needless to say, yes, I left Friday's happy and full.

The people at this TGI Fridays are some of the nicest servers/wait staff I've ever seen. Not obnoxious cheesy nice just genuinely good people. Made me feel like I was at a 5 star Resturant. The food is always good at this chain so it was to be expected. I didn't expect the wonderful service. I always wanted to try this one cause I always see it after leaving riverside square. So glad I did ill def be back

Went in here for lunch right around Thanksgiving and the place was empty. It was an off hour for lunch, I'll give you that. We decided to sit at the bar and see what happens. You would figure being sandwiched right in between two office buildings there would be a few more people. Bartender was friendly, not overbearing which is a good thing. Checked in on us as necessary to see how we were doing. Ordered some apps which were fantastic. I think we picked the potstickers, the skins and the boneless wings. Then it was on to the sandwich, I got the Jack Daniels grilled chicken and it was pretty good.  In all, I would definitely be back for a few more rounds and some grub.
Bar service is terrible. They need to hire more staff, it shouldn't take 20 mins to get an lit.

Shrunken portions, rubbery chicken, and when we honestly answered our waitress when she asked how everything was, a manager didn't even bother to come to our table of 5. Disappointed on several levels. NOTE: This review was from 2011, but was just "Finalized" and was not submitted at the time it was originally written so it bears a later date.

I normally would not give such a low rating but went here tonight and had an experience like non other. Drinks came in a reasonable time and appetizers were good. We were even impressed that they were not rushing us through our food. The issues started when our main courses came. Steaks were ordered medium and came well done. When I asked the server to have it redone he actually attempted to take just the steak back to the kitchen on a napkin and leave the mashed potatoes to get ice cold. By the time I got my meal everyone else had finished their food. The manager came over and apologized but when the bill arrived they actually had the nerve to charge me. Not even a complementary drink or appetizer.  Will spend my money elsewhere from now on.
Worst TGI Friday's you will ever go to. Do not eat here unless you want to get sick. Been there twice and both times got very sick. Health department should shut them down.

I have to said this place totally ruined the tgi chain. The service are bad , food are totally not taste same also the drink . I will recommend go some other place . I'm a fan of JD . Quality break down.

So honestly the food was average and probably not the healthiest, but if you've been to a TGIFridays you know that coming in! The service however was really great! From the moment we walked in  service was just really great. The greeter was a nice, courteous young man and our waiter was awesome and attentive! I see the other reviews are less than stellar so maybe, hopefully, they're trying, we did appetizers only because my boys know what they like so for us that was the way to go . They enjoyed the Jack Daniels strips, fries and mozzarella sticks. Yes - maybe stick to what you know here. Nachos were also good and our waiter - so sorry I forgot his name- I have to stop doing that for yelp's sake- but he had somewhat long dark hair- and he was really personable and attentive! Drinks were refilled without us asking which was great! Not my first choice to be honest -but the kids love it here and if they're happy, well life is good.  I'll continue to bring them as long as the service remains the same as I experienced tonight because well for some darned reason my boys love it here! Oh and the atmosphere is noisy so no worries if the kids are a bit loud!

This place (in my opinion) is by far the worst Friday's in the entire chain !   It starts witht the fact that there is no place to sit in the restaurant to wait for the others in your party....Just a guess...but perhaps they want to force you to wait and drink at the bar ?   The service at the bar is horrible.   One has to wait and wait.  Again my opinion , but the bartenders are more involved with socializing than helping customers.    On the night I was there the restaurant was only 1/2 open..   Every customer walking in was seated in the same area, almost on top of each other...very loud...no privacy, etc.... all the while the remaining portions of the restaurant were dark and unocupied !  The person showing us to the table was sucking on a lollypop...very unprofessional !    We waited and watied for a server to appear.   About 15 mintues later she finally did.  We mentioned that we wanted to take advantage of the unlimited appetizers......we ordered two different ...the first one came with a promise of the 2nd one in a few minutes.   That never came.  We order another round....and they came with our entrees at the same time.  We then ordered another round....this time again only one came.  No apology...just a promise that the other one is one the way...which never happened.   We asked for water for everyone....never came.   We requested another round of sodas....took 10 minutes ...(wings get hot !!!)  The check appeared when we were about 3/4 the way through the entree.   The mgr came over and said hello and asked how everything is going.  He was dress rather in a weird way...not very professional...we told him that we never received some of our endless appitizers....he smiled and apologized, then walked away !   We were never asked if we wanted desert....we waited and waited for the server, but she never came back...we just left the money on the table and walked out....the only good part was that someone held the door as we exited the restaurant.   Oh, the womens restroom had no paper towels (so I was told)...... All in all...there are too many restaurants within walking distance that you can get better service, better food all for the same price.   One has to wonder why the other restaruants have a line to get into, while Fridays has 1/2 the place dark ???
They have loud music blasting here. The appetizers seem like they have been made before hours and not fresh. happy hour drinks are watered. food portions are also not that great....

Worse TGIF ever, service is horrible. Food presentation sucks. Service is slow. I kept trying this location because it's close to home but why bother when there's so many great restaurants in the area.

The fact is you're coming to a TGIFridays so you need to bottom line be realistic with your expectations and based on my expectations for a chain restaurant I thought it was a decent low key night out. The mojitos were sweet but did its job. The all you can eat apps for $10 were fine: the spinach dip came with long chips; the boneless wing bites were spicy; the mozzarella sticks were just what they were supposed to be. The bruschetta was slightly disappointing and maybe cause that was the "freshest" thing we ordered but I enjoyed the chunks of garlic. We sat by the bar the server wasn't always available but once we flagged them down they were great.  Clean bathrooms, ample parking, a fun low key night out!

This place does not deserve even a star... I went today with a party of 7 and it took the waiter 50 minutes to bring just the appetizers. The drinks were not that good either... you could barely taste the alcohol. The food was ok, not really the quality you expect at TGI Fridays. If you are looking for a decent meal, I suggest you go somewhere else to eat.
Good Luck getting service, I went their on an empty night and it takes 45 min just for wings. Took another 20 just for a refill. It makes sense why not too many people were  there.

I went to fridays and sat at the bar there was a bartender named sam who did not look like he wanted to be there. It was a little f*cked up because usually theres two bartenders there, so anyway he was a little moody and kinda brushed me off because he had other customers to attend to.  I dont blame him although i made it clear verbally that i wasnt happy with the service because they ran out of stella and they promoted it on there Tuesday happy hour menu.  This fridays has good food and a nice selction of beer but the wait staff are clumsy always dropping things in the dinning room. Ive been here twice and  both times ...

Okay so this is the best fridays i have ever been at!!! No more franchises for me, I will stick with this corporate location. Food is good, service was good. Special shout out to kacey! THe general mgr is good who even came by our table to see who we were doing and helped bus. Cant wait to go back.

Pretty average TGI Friday's. Food is exactly what you would expect from this chain of restaurants. Located between two office buildings. I find it hard to review chain restaurants as they are normally all the same. I had an issue here were my credit card was not properly returned to me after a paid my bill. The manager took zero responsibility for this. Service was barely OK. I will only return to this location if I have no other choices. I have no praise to give to this location. I find that a store shows it true colors when problems occur. The manager at this location just showed that he cared as little as the rest of the staff- basically felt to me like they all were just trying to get to the end of their shifts; no one here goes the extra mile.

The worst. Yelp needs to get a zero stars option. I went to the bar for happy hour specials and it took me no less that 30 minutes to flag down a server to acknowledge me. The bartender was lazy and uninterested in serving me but I gave him a pass because I wouldn't want to work on a day with so many discounted (and endless refill) items either. As the dinner went on I realized that maybe I was too nice. I never got half the apps I ordered and when I told him that he rolled his eyes and walked away. Okay...? Eventually 1 hour + later, I got sick of waiting around. I asked him for the check and he comes back about 20 minutes later. When my card is returned to me, he actually has the nerve to STAND THERE next to me, less that 1 foot away, to see how much I'm going to tip him. He did not pre-bus my table, he cleared away ZERO cups and dishes my entire time there, he did not refill a single beverage, but he decides he has the time to wait there while I write his tip... Really. Now, I'm usually 20%+ tipper even on mediocre service because I've been a server before and it SUCKS but this time I had no mercy. On the $80 check I gave him $3 because he shamelessly and offensively stood there to make sure he was going to get tipped. Didn't make small talk or even pretend like he wasn't spying over the shoulder as I signed the slip. Well jokes on you, because you just bit yourself in the a@@. He doesn't bid me farewell, just walks away. Fast forward to 3 days later.... I get my credit card statement. This server, JUSTIN, took it upon himself to change the tip I left him to $15 dollars!!!! Are you f*cking kidding me?? He committed FRAUD and STOLE from me by giving himself more money and he thought I wouldn't notice??? I had to call the store and go through like 5 managers to finally reach the GM. One manager refunded me the stolen tip and didn't offer me any other resolution. The GM was nice enough after I put him in his place and they refunded me the full meal. But I had to fight for it. What kind of place is this? They acted like "oh well, this happens sometimes. Do you want to get that money back...?" What a horrible way to run the business.You will never catch me at this TGIF again and I hope to GOD they fired that POS Justin.  Oh yeah, and the food was cold the drinks were watered down (as usual, per Fridays nature), the steak was tasteless and the lobster looked like a shrimp. AND my boyfriend got sick the next day soo I'd say this place is a complete and total DUMP. But I didn't expect fine dining from a TGIF. I did however expect to not be scammed by a slimy bartender.  Don't eat here.

Wow - tons of bad reviews but I always like this location. Bar is active and servers are friendly. The food is typical chain food.   Love most of the apps - wings, pot stickers and pretzels with dipping sauce are all good.   My man loves the Jack Daniels ribeye. They always seem to be updating the menu with new items. Overall, every now and then I want to eat at a Fridays and this one always gets it right!

First off I would like to say that I've been to other Friday's where the service is much better.  My wife originally called at 4pm to let them know a party of 13 will be there at 6pm they explained that they don't take reservation but they'll write our name on the waiting list. She called again at at 5:50 letting them know we were on our way.  Once we arrived they told us it'll be a 30 minute wait my frustration is growing at this point.  So it's 7:15pm we decided to call Applebee's that was right across.  Applebee's took our reservation over the phone told it'll be 30min they did better our table was ready in 15min.  It's 7:30pm when we decided to leave Friday's and explained our frustration to management who didn't seem very apologetic.  The manager Doug is close to shouting that he can't control how long people decide to pay their checks or how long they take to eat.  I would think after such a bad experience the only words out of your mouth should be "I'm sorry I do apologize for the long wait" but he seemed to get mad at me for complaining, guess your not allowed to complain.  All in all I won't be coming back to this Friday's location and I urge everyone else to do the same, unless you want your Saturday night ruined.

The staff was a bit slow but friendly enough. The food was alright. It's a TGIFriday's, I don't expect much. However, for the money, I think I'd prefer hitting up elsewhere when it's about $15-20 a plate.  Not the best - not the worst.

Had a great time here on a Tuesday night. It was $5 jack drinks all day and they also have this low price menu for select drinks that is everyday. $5 LITs. I haven't been to Friday's in a long time and they updated their menu. They have the unlimited appetizers with a limited selection. They have 2 for $16 now instead of 2 for $10 or 2 for $12. Just seems like the food up'd in price a bit but it's cool. Friday's food doesn't disappoint me at all.  So I order the three taste and share for $16; bacon mac & cheese bites, thai pork tacos, and corned beef & swiss sliders. They were all so tasty. The mac and cheese in the fried balls was filled with gooey cheese it was delicious. The thai pork taco had good taste to it but the whole taco itself was cold which was disappointing. The sliders were amazing, they are on a nice soft pretzel bun, comes with pickle, and the onions on the slider were to die for, sweet and full of flavor. They were the best out of the three. My friend got the 2 for $16 , the bbq flatbread pizza with the steak and fries. Her steak was pretty good and the fries were perfectly salty. Our drinks were super good too. I had an LIT and she had the peach honey smash or something like that. It was super good and not too sweet.

By far the worst sanitary restaurant I have ever seen. The lack of ethics the member showed by inserting their bare hands in my food after it being made incorrectly turned my stomach. The lack of compassion once he noticed I had seen him brings great concern on how many other merchants he has done this to. Customer service at its worst.

I happen to be a Stripes member and was looking for a Friday's location since: A. I happened to be in Jersey B. I was craving those bacon covered jalapeños they keep advertising  and  C. This was the closest location to the GWB I could find  Now, when you're driving here it can be a bit confusing on where the entrance is, but once you find the parking lot you're set. During my visit it was a bit late in the evening and there were a couple of happy hour deals going on. My boyfriend and I went inside and sat by the bar. We ordered a few of the $5 appetizers along with a pint of beer and cider. They have a few drink specials, but I wasn't really interested.  The bacon wrapped jalapeños were EVERYTHING and more. I thought 4 wouldn't be enough, but that was just the right amount.  Conclusion: Service is pretty average, wait time is quick, and the food was good.

I will never be caught dead in this restaurant again. 1. We got seated in what seemed like the dirtiest part of the restaurant. The floors had crumbs and napkins on the floor and about 2 of the tables sat dirty for our entire meal. Even our table was not clean, my arm after leaning was stuck in some sticky substance. 2. The area was split by two waitresses, we were stuck with a very slow and non-friendly waitress. She was in slow motion and took forever for things to come out. Anything from soda to our meals. Thank god we didn't get an appetizers or I think I would still be sitting there. 3. My meal was so tiny that I was still hungry after. Typically when I order the jack Daniel's chicken strips I have enough for an entire other meal. There was maybe 4/5 small pieces. And it was cold. My boyfriends chicken was chewy. Yes - chewy. 4. We would have complained but it was very rare that we saw her. We didn't even get a second round of drinks.By the time we had her back we just wanted the check and to leave. I've been here before and although it wasn't 100% perfect it was always decent. But that's the last time I will ever, ever go back. Do yourself a favor and go to the Applebee's across the street.

I went for happy hour, and was disappointed with the service and cleanliness. Also, they "ran out" of the only non-light happy hour beer, and refused to substitute anything else. So I ended up without any happy hour deals; since I wouldn't drink Coors Light.  Very dirty location, and the manager needs to pull his act together. The bar smelled; and the floors were sticky. Not at all up to par with an average "Friday's".
The worst nachos I have ever experienced  at any restaurant. I believe this is not due to the staff but to a poor menu  design

Let me start off by saying: This is the first time I actually went after people were always talking about it... Now, we go inside, and it is nice. It was half empty. Everyone was about to go home. That's pretty much it. We go inside and they asked us how much and we told him and they showers us to our table... As soon as he showed us to our table, he didn't come back until 10 minutes later and then asked us for beverages. He comes back 20 minutes with our beverages. Then he asked us for our food and we have him the order.  We did the regular thing of waiting (by taking out our phones) for our waiter to serve the food and all, and comes back an hour later with the food. Everyone is wondering "Why did the food take this long to make?" But it's fine since it was my first time coming here. (Keep in mind, it was just 4 appetizers--should not take that long to make) The food was great, especially with the endless appetizers for only $10. Great food and great deal!  Only issue (s) I didn't like were the customer service. Customer service was low, I've never seen horrendous customer service. The great part was the food! That's pretty much it... Overall, it is up to you to decide whether you would like to come here or not. Bad service with great food.

Just the average Friday's. We hadn't been here in a while and we had a gift card to use. Everything tasted great. Our waiter was awesome. Super nice and making jokes like we've been friends for a while.

Excellent service, atmosphere is good - not too loud even though it's a "sports bar." Food was decent, had standard cheeseburger and fries. They listened to my medium well instructions which is kind of unusual. Would definitely go back for a burger. I didn't have a apps but I'm sure there good - saw a lot of them fly by the table and was very tempted. Drinks are a little watered down but again pretty typical for these types of places.

Good service nice staff and what more can I say it's fast food but good quality fast food that I enjoyed very much. Don't come here often but I love the decor and it's a fun atmosphere too hang with friends and family

Went out tonight to this restaurant and what a disappointment with food and service.  I got Mahi Mahi. Fish was overdone, mashed potatoes tasted like out of the box.  Food was not seasoned and tasteless.  My daughter had chicken and shrimp with mashed potatoes and she just ate shrimp.  Everything else on a plate went to garbage.  I would not even consider it a leftover...waste of money and time.  Will never go back to this place again.  It's worse than McDonalds.  Waitress looked tired and unhappy.  Had to wait forever to get our drinks.  Very depressing and unhappy.

Service it's OK on a good night. Everytime i have come to this Fridays everything takes a while even when they are almost empty. Waiters don't pay enough attention to you and you may wait 10 minutes for a refill (like me right now). Worst part is they tend to overcook your food, so if you like medium well you gonna get well done. This is a place to come if you are really close and you just need to eat something. With so many restaurants a few hundred feet away (cheesecake factory, maggianos, pf change etc) there's no reason to come here.

The place looks great with it's new renovations and the food for the most part was good.  We sat at the bar, because the dining area was packed and there was a 45 min - an hour wait time.  We had the slider as an appetizer and the shrimp was not cooked.  The bartender's (young male), excuse was "shrimp is always mushy".  However, the shrimp WAS RAW.  It was not cooked.  He didn't even look at the shrimp when we showed him, he mumbled an apology, but didn't ask if we wanted another batch, nor did he offer to take some money off the bill.  This is not professional.  Perhaps they need better bartenders who can also serve with professionalism.  We only came here because every other place in Bergen County on a Saturday night had an exceptionally long wait time.  Serving raw fish gets people very ill and the lack of apology we received from this young guy was disturbing.  We won't be back because of him.

I am so disappointed with this place first off they are very under staffed. When we arrived they had about 20 open booths, tables, and chairs but there was still a 25-30 minute wait. When we finally got a table it took our waiter about 15 to get to us because she had to deal with 13 other tables. When we got to order our entrees we both ordered medium well burgers. When we got them they were both badly over cooked. I don't like sending food back so I didn't but my girlfriend did. When she got the second one that one was cooked more than the first one but at this point we didn't even want to be bothered anymore. Now we are at home I have the runs and she is throwing up. Never will we go back to this place again. What a way to waste a Saturday dinner at Fridays
We were sat by a server and they made us get up out our seats! Smh ridiculous!! We left without eating after 30 minutes

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. I was in the area with a few friends and we decided we've never been to a Friday's, so we thought it would be nice to grab something to eat.  After looking at the menu for a few minutes, our waiter approached us and I think(not positive) his name was Jesus. Immediately, he has an awful attitude and when it's time to order food, he says very nasty: "What do you want?" Are you serious? Then he continues to have a horrible attitude and at the end of ordering he says: "I'm sorry for the attitude, I'm just pissed because I'm still f**** here." Um? Did we ask? I don't need to be treated horribly because you had a bad night. We all have bad nights but he made us extremely uncomfortable. I got my food, it was alright. The chicken was alright, the sauce was a little funky. My friends hated their food, however. I only ate half the plate before I got full and our waiter comes back and says, "what happened? Is it gross?" And I said "no, I am full" and he shocks the whole table: "Well it seems like you wasted your money, this is a huge waste of money. You should've gotten the something else if you thought it was that gross." WHAT? This guy had so much attitude and made our experience horrible. The only time he was nice was when my friend slipped him his tip, go figure. Worst server I have ever had! My friends and I even talked about him for twenty minutes after about how unprofessional he was. He made us feel so uncomfortable that we didn't even want him to come back to the table. Never coming here ever again!

Got a coupon in the mail which enticed me. I haven't been here for at least 15 years!  I was surprised, the food was decent.  An appetizer of pot stickers followed by the Jack Daniels ribs...not bad at all. Service was quick but attentiveness to the customers was lacking....and business was slow, it was July 4th.

Hadn't been here in a while, so I decided to meet some friends for dinner. I was quickly reminded why we stopped coming here. We experienced the worst service we've ever dealt with before. We were seated promptly, but our waitress was less than pleasant and forgot to put in one person's entire order. We only ordered soups and appetizers, and we had to wait an additional 20 minutes for her food to come out. When we were ready for the check, we couldn't find our waitress for a solid 15 minutes, and then it was almost another 15 before she came back to get our payment. In addition, the ladies room floor felt like it was mopped with soda. I thought my sandals were going to break because they were sticking to the floor and being ripped up violently every time I moved. I won't be coming back to this location.
Good food classic go to pretty busy on Friday's  pun intended  Lol server was on point was able to redeem a 20% off coupon   Great priced drinks

Went there last night and my stomach is still paying the price, food made me sick. The bartenders were drinking alcohol and cursing like sailors.  This place is not like other FRIDAYS  they have DJS, music so loud you can't even have a conversation. it's dirty as well   Will not go there again

TGIF, as a restaurant, is always good .... Fun, throw-back decor, upbeat atmosphere and the perfect combination for parents -- kid-friendly atmosphere + decent food and cocktails for mom and dad!   For all that I'd rate this specific location as a solid 3 ... Typical TGIF but just borderline dingy, a bit urban. HOWEVER, the service today was terrible!    The waitress could not have been more slow or indifferent.    Very slow to come get our drink and food order, seemed surprised when we asked for plates, and would disappear for 10 minutes at a time.    After waiting 15 minutes for her to come back to take the check I asked the hostess, in desperation, if she could either process the credit card or find the waitress.  In a sassy fashion she pointed out to me that she was a hostess and couldn't/wouldn't get involved.     She said I'd just have to wait for our waitress!
Went their on Friday night and there was no wait time...food and drinks were good..dedo a good hang out spot
Sunday Funday at the Bar. Can't afford not to ! Hey.. No one community here is a gourmet? $5 LIT & $5 Apps during games! It wouldn't be here 40 + years if it'd that bad.
Food made me sick. Server never came back to ask if we needed refills or to check on us. Bathroom was disgusting. Some of the silverware was dirty. Never coming here again.

We went there on my cousins birthday, and announced to the entire table it was her bday with the waitress standing there. First of all, the waitress must've been high or drunk bc nobody is that stupid. She told us, jokingly, that she would give us a free meal if she could take home our friends baby.  Who says that?  When we ordered our drinks it took us forever to get them and she would take one order at a time! I ordered a Cobb salad and told her to stick the dressing that comes with it on the side (balsamic vinaigrette). She brought me out a salad with blue cheese dressing then proceeded to say "don't you remember you told me you wanted blue cheese?" Everyone at the table looked at her like she was cray cray. At least it was on the side! The best part was that we ordered birthday shots for my cousin, and told her they were for her birthday! 3 minutes later we hear their thematic clapping birthday song and got excited bc who doesn't like being brought out a b day brownie? ... different table. Then, again about 5 minutes later... different table again!! Finally a third time and another round of drinks later, we heard the clapping once more! Another table?!?!? While she was hovering over the check while we were paying, a friend asked why my cousin never got the bday song? Her reply? "I didn't bring it because you look like you would be the type of person who wants sparklers at a NYC lounge and we don't do that here!" We just couldn't believe she said something that idiotic!!  ... here's a pic of the table, alll the drinks that weren't cleared off the entire night. What a horrific experience, I can't even fit in all the absurd details!

Came here on a Saturday night and to my surprise it was not packed as the restaurants across the road (which waiting time was over and hour and a half). We were seated immediately. I was kind of worried because the place was not busy, and again it was a Saturday night. The staff is friendly and the food was good. The only thing I can complain about is that the waitress took a long time to bring out our drinks and food, especially with the fact that they were not that busy. Would try it again.

I went here not to long ago with a group of friends . I've been here a few times and it was decent service and the food was typical Fridays food. Unfortunately this time we had the pleasure of having a server l (I don't remember his name or quite frankly anything about him!) that had no idea what he was doing. He came to our table took our drink orders and disappeared. We were all ready to order by the time he came back with the drinks ( which had to be more that 20 minutes later). Our food came out and it was ridiculous. Some of us didn't get food at all . My friend got a completely different order than what she wanted. He sort of corrected his mistake and we literally didn't see him after that. We had to chase him down for our check. Mind you it wasn't busy what so ever . Just a bad experience.

Went last Saturday, terrible service. My entree came out before the appetizer. Not sure if the waitress forgot to place it or if the kitchen was at fault. Worst of all the answer I got, " Oh do you still want that" ? Of course i want my appetizer if not I wouldn't have placed the order to begin with

I don't even know where to start. After sitting down, we waited 30 minutes before anyone even took our drinks. Then we waited another 30 minutes for what I presumed to be microwaved chicken wings. To be fair, I think only one person was taking orders but that seems to be a management issue. My coke was completely flat and had been sitting for well over 10 minutes. Very poor experience, even from a TGI Fridays.

Not terrible for the price, but could be much better if it were properly run.  First off, it's like somebody took pancake syrup and sprayed it randomly around the bar area. There were sticky spots on the floor, on the bar and on the menus. Gross.  We ordered two endless appetizers for $10 each. Boneless Buffalo wings and meatballs. We thought the catch was going to be not being able to get prompt refills. That was a non-issue; the food came out quickly, but just barely warm. We complained about the coldness of the food after round one which was the most generously sized. The next two smaller plates were marginally warmer, but still not hot enough. The food itself was OK but it was clearly frozen and reheated incompletely. Had it been properly heated, I may have thought the wings were at least fried there.  The $4 Blue Moons at 23 ounces were a good deal. Husband got Coors Light same size and price.  After all, not terrible for what we spent, but we won't be hurrying back. There are too many better places to visit for HH on a Friday evening.

The staff is rude, unaccommodating, and slow. They were standing around, talking to one another. We had to ask for utensils three times, our waiter came around once in total. Very VERY disappointed, considering this restaurant was never this way. We will not be returning here ever again. We were 4 people and had 5 fork 5 knifes  and 3 napkins .. it took over 25 min to get a refill on water ... I will never come back. Oh and my sandwich only came with one side of the bun....

This restaurant is extremely dirty. There were napkins, wrappers, and food on every inch of the floor. The empty tables were left uncleaned and neglected way longer than they should be. To make matters even worse, I found a few shredded pieces of paper in my drink. To say the least, I was not happy. Our server was sweet and friendly, but besides that, the whole experience completely disgusted me. I would NEVER recommend anybody to come here.

I normally always have a pleasant,  great experience. But lately service has been horrible.  When sitting at tables in the bar area not at the bar service lately is awful.  I can't begin to go into details. I'm surprised and disappointed because I've always loved only this location and always had great service.  Unfortunately lately the service has dropped they take to long to come take the order or they don't get the order right or they don't come back to see if you need another drink or anything else when you so ask for another drink your right by them and it still takes forever.  When your done waiting for checking or a box you wait forever to the point the putting on your coat and getting your stuff together they get the hint.

Sitting here in Friday's... in the bar area. Service is HORRIBLE! I have been given 2 rounds of food without being asked if I was ok or if I needed a beverage. Food was bad, edible but nothing to brag about. Very dissatisfied with everything that has gone on & have been coming here since I was a young girl. They have completely fallen off

Worst place to order from or go to! they are very disorganized and never get orders right. Ive had it with this Friday's. Every time we order to pick up either they get the order wrong, or they state that the order was never made! I have even had to show them the phone call made to them so they believe it!! And maybe try to make a change!! But just today they did it again!! Done! Dont go there they are a mess!

Arrived around 4pm, and sat in the bar area unattended for 15 minutes. It wasn't until my friend asked the hostess, "where are the waiters?", then we were served. We were the ONLY customers in the restaurant. If it wasn't for the really good food (compared to Wayne & Clifton locations), I would of given 1 star based on the poor customer service. Step it up, Hackensack! You got the potential!

Came here for lunch around 4pm with a friend and we sat in the bar area. The place was literally empty! We were the only customers, but it took about 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge us. They only came after I asked the greeter where the waiters are.  The food was hot and actually really good here, but the service was so slow and it was so empty. Like why does it take you so long to come check on us when no one else is here?!

We went on 3/19/17 @ 3:00.    3 adults 2 kids.   1.  Place was empty, asked for big booth for the kids, we were told all booth were being clean or were occupied and it would take 30 min to clean 2.  Got put in big table in corner, after a 10 min wait (place empty)  3.  Took 10 min for waitress to come, then additional 20 mins to get 2 beers and juice. Finally order app and dinner.  4. 15 min later.  App comes with long hair on plate ( clear as day).     Tell waitress, whips off food off table and says "whatever" and takes off.   Walked out.    Never again!

Worst dining experience of my life sat near the bar waited 30 minutes until i went up and asked the bartender for menus asked him for a drink and he refused to give it to me and made me wait for the waitress who took another 15 minutes to ask me for my drinks i than got endless apps and waited 30 minutes for my first plate, take note i still haven't gotten my drink. when i got the food i put in another order and it took another 25 minutes and they brought me the wrong thing. I than asked for another order witch took 25 minutes. so i told them how i was feeling about the service and the way they were treating me and asked them for a box they than refused and i asked if i could speak to the manager he took 15 minutes to come to me and i began to tell him about the service and the way the waitress treated me. He than told me i could not have a box that it was there policy take note i had 6 boneless wings I wanted to take home he than walked away from me stating he could not help me i than noticed a box on the bar unattended directly across from my table so i grabbed it and began to put my food in it and out of no where i feel a hand on my shoulder and the bartender rips the box with my food in it and stated take something off my bar again see what happens and walked away with my food and the box. I will never go there again I advise people to stay away from this location.

I will never come back again. The place was dirty. The utensils were dirty. The menus were sticky. The ketchup was sticky. The waitress wasn't very attentive. She didn't clear the table when we were already done.  We were already done with desert and our empty entré plates were still on the table. If the front of the house was that dirty it scares me to imagine how dirty the kitchen must have been. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there. It isn't worth the money.

Probably the worse restaurant I've ever been to. The menu was dirty. Our utensils were dirty. Our napkins were wet. Our food didn't come in together. The waitress we had looked grumpy and did a lousy job on being helpful. If I was the owner, people will lose their jobs. I recommend Smash Burgers or Shake Shack for a better burger. Definitely not satisfied.

Worst experience I have ever had. My boyfriend and I came here for date night this evening for dinner and drinks, but when we got there we were waiting for 10 minutes for someone to seat us. When someone finally arrived, the lady said they were understaffed and it would be 20 minute wait. Which is fine, we understand Thursday is not normally a busy day. However, another couple came without a reservation and another employee greeted them and sat them down right away, while we were still waiting. When we did finally get seated  we then waited for an additional 20 minutes! My boyfriend and I couldn't believe this wait, since we didn't even meet our server let alone ask if we needed anything to drink, we left... turns out 4 employees were just chatting together by a table, while the bar tender was serving tables. Honestly unbelievable experience in the worst way. Next time will be going to the Clifton's Tgifridays.
Big, spacious Friday's compared to others I have been. Food was good and fresh. Bar is great for watching sports events.

Really bad service. I think no one care about the customer in GTI Friday. Bad food. I order the broccoli shredded cheese soup. The waiter only gave me half bowl of the soup and taste so salty! I told the different waiter about the soup. I think a manager came to ask me do you want to change different kind of soup. He said the onion soup pretty good. So I got the onion soup. I try it and I feel I want to spit it out. So salty and taste like soy sauce!!!! So disappointed!!!!! I really don't want to give them tips!!!  Never go back again! Bad service!!!!! Bad food!!!!!!!!!

I'm honestly not sure I've ever had worse service at a restaurant.  My group arrived 2 hours before closing and it was busy enough that there was no reason to be closing early, but no so busy that there was any reason for it to take 10 minutes for us to be seated and another 10 for our waiter to show up.  We could actually see most of them just hanging out by the kitchen or in the back.  As it turns out, we're pretty sure they were actually stalling because when the waiter arrived and told us the kitchen closes endless apps in five minutes.  She took our orders for drinks and said she'd be right back to take our orders with our drinks and it was almost another ten minutes before she came back with the drinks.  After the food came out she was nowhere to be seen until it was too late to order dessert, let us order dessert, and then came back with the check to let us know the kitchen was closed.

Terrible service. Almost 40 minutes wait to just get out drinks. For all that wait they dropped off the wrong order and quickly walk away not wanting to be bothered. This place used to be nice n well serviced. It's gone down the drains.

TERRIBLE!  What is the point of endless appetizers if your waiter never comes back?? This happened to me three times in this location and every other time I've been there the service is completely awful. Unfortunately this is the closest one to my house but I will not ever be going back again.

Really never a been big fan of TGIF. Service at this location was very poor. Place seemed a bit dirty and my friend and I never got utensils so we decided to get up and get it on our own. Our waiter went missing most of the night. In regards to the food, it's a chain restaurant, your getting what you pay for. Prices are actually pretty decent and their drinks are not as bad as I imagined them to be.
Always pretty good and on point in terms of presentation and food quality overall. Not sure why so many rare poorly but in my 9 check ins it's been pretty good with no complaints

The food was good but the service was terrible i sat at the bar on july 3rd about 1:00pm the bartender definitely didn't care or bother to ask how the food was or if I wanted another beer, at the end of the meal he just put the check down and walked away and the place was almost empty i do not plan on ever coming back.

I'd leave no stars if I could . I walked in on 7/27/17 around 9:30 pm .  I opened the front door , walked in and was greeted by a bunch of scattered papers flying about and an empty hostess stand  covered in knocked over crayons , papers and toothpicks - but no human. So...... I showed myself to an empty seat at the bar . I sit on the chair and it's broken/off balance and I almost fell off ha. So, I switched the chairs and sat down , I was soo starving I just wanted to eat. So as I'm sitting a young lady (bartender) is entering in the bar and she makes eye contact with me , smiles and says hello . Simultaneously there is a big crash of dishes on the other side of the bar so she scurries over to see what happened , and that's the last time she or ANY other employee acknowledged my presence. Well about 10 min after I'm sitting at the bar  staring into space waiting for a menu or something , the same young lady walks by and without looking at me at all,  just slides a menu to me on the bar . Ok... I've Been in the food service business for almost 20 yrs , and even though I was starving , I will NOT spend my hard earned money in a place where I'm not even acknowledged as a customer and the food is mediocre at best. It's a NO from me lol.

Me and my girlfriend sat at a table for 20 minutes without any waiter or waitress to greet us and take our orders.  After the first 15 minutes,  I went to the hostess stand and complained about the lack of service.  I was told a server was going to be with us. 5 minutes later...guess what, no service! Servers kept walking by and no one took our order. I took my girlfriend and left. Never going back. Horrible customer service

This place has horrible service!!! Theyre staff is slow and they are always some how understaffed. It took me and my boyfriend about 45 minutes to get a plate of wings... when we finally get it... the plate is dirty and the order isnt even right. Dont come here its an absolute waste of time & money!

Good food. Mediocre service. Not crowded for a Saturday evening. We got the spinach dip app which had fresh spinach in it, jack Daniels chicken and shrimp, and Buffalo Wingman Burger. Burger was awesome. Very juicy and cooked perfectly.

The waiter wasn't great but the food was Really good. I had a Strawberry Field salad with Salmon. The Salmon was burnt. My one guest had the same thing and ordered her salad with romaine lettuce instead of mix greens and she got half and half. Another guest got a bruschetta pasta and his pasta was cold. Another guest had her Friday's card and the waiter didn't know what to do with it.

I'll just list everything. Negatives: - No hostess at the front - Server doesn't know the menu or specials - Have to ask for everything from straws to napkins and plates - Alcoholic beverages made very poorly. Probably the worst LIT I've ever had - Manager never checked in to see how everything was but seen floating around and seems to have poor attitude and demeanor Positives: - Food was prepared well and in a timely manner so kudos to the kitchen staff! - Fast seating because the place was practically empty but they also look like they're closed from the outside - Server was very nice

Needed something quick, so I had the Sizzling Chicken Cheesy. Simple enough I thought. Well, I was wrong. The cheese was under the chicken, so it burned so badly that it was very bitter. As for the Chicken, it was as dry as a piece of wood.

As a server myself - I am always extremely lenient when it comes to service at other restaurants.  As a patron you have no idea what the server is going through in their personal life, with the job, and sometimes it's just a bad day.  However, what happened last night is outside of all of this. Monday night, September 11, 2017- quick dinner before heading to the Paul McCartney concert. Four people for dinner - one with special needs. Menus- some were missing pages, ketchup inside one, and we were refused outdoor seating even though the tables were set for out door seating. Drinks- server didn't know what wines and beers were on happy hour. Ordering food - we were extremely specific: one Cobb salad and two sizzling chicken and shrimp. One person was sharing their sizzling chicken and shrimp with the special needs person. We even repeated this- and she repeated it back to us. Waited a total of 25 mins for food- strange because we were one of 7 tables in the entire restaurant.  Arrival of food- you guessed it - she screwed up the order - we received two Cobb salads and no sizzling chicken and shrimps. We tried to be understanding and said that we'd eat the extra Cobb salad and just bring one chicken and shrimp sizzler. Btw- our drinks were not refilled once at this point. Ten minuets later - the manager came over and asked which salad we wanted the chicken and shrimp on!  We told the lovely manager what we ordered and what we received and that we'd just take one chicken and shrimp. She said she would rush it. After waiting sixteen minutes- we begged to get the dinner to go, and for the check. Check came- no discount, nothing on the house, and the server actually put a heart around the part where it leaves the percentages of tips to leave. Sorry- until you learn the menu, take your job seriously, write it down, and get an order remotely correct, you won't get 20% from me. (Yes, we did tip her). Needless to say - not a good experience and we won't be back.

This location has the worst service of any Friday's I've frequented. They seat and then totally forget about you when you choose the bar area (I guess we're not important enough?) Food comes out either Slow, Cold, Wrong or ALL OF THE ABOVE. Then when you ask for a manager he/she is of little help to rectify the situation! This review comes after visiting this location three separate times so this is not me being biased. Very disappointed. Try Wayne if you want decent service.

I almost don't know where to begin. I'm not sure if the waiter was new but the service was very lacking. There were no suggestions or specials as far as I know. He seemed clueless to any question. We had to ask for everything: a glass for the sparkling water, napkins, plates for our appetizers.  When I did get our food the "fall off the bone ribs" were hard. I couldn't even cut into them. My mother's food was cold. I returned my plate and ordered something else. I specified how I wanted it, when the food came the waiter repeated it was how I wanted. I get it and again it's wrong. Worst service all around. I repeated my unhappiness and not once did a manager come by nor did the waiter seem to care. Last time I will go here.

Dont waste your money and time. I was there last night and wanted to take a day before writing a bad review. After sleeping on it I realized the experience was too bad to let go. Lets start with the service. It took a waiter forever to get to us and when it was time for drinks she got it wrong. I ask for a water with a lemon or lime wedge and she said they didn't have. They have a bar with no lime or lemons!?? I doubt it. Then after a long wait, we ordered straight dinner because we didn't want to wait longer for appetizers. Basic order, burgers and pasta. Food too long, then when it came out the pasta was cold and the burgers were Hockey pucks.  As far as the location, it was filthy. Trash on the floor and tables dirty. I was hungry and ate there but was grossed out with the cleanliness of the place. Its a-shame because TGI Fridays are usually sure things.

Horrible experience. Terrible service. The waitress was very rude and unprofessional. Had no regard for proper customer service. The manager attempted to make us pay for food in which we never recieved.

This location has the worst staff ever. The waitress we had was so unprofessional. The manager wasn't any better. Our order didn't even get to our table we asked for the check cause the waitress so so rude to us. We wanted to pay for our drinks and leave. The manager himself came back with the check and honestly tried to charge us for the food that was still been prepared. I will never set foot there. I do not recommend.

Honestly pretty awful. The staff is terrible here. One time I went here and nobody else was there and they told us there was a wait. We were the only people in the restaurant. Most recently, I ordered a burger medium rare and it looked like they took a patty out of the freezer and placed it on a bun. It was pretty much raw. When I complained to the waiter she said you wanted it medium rare. Waiters shouldn't blame flaws with the food on the customer. Don't come here. Riverside Mall is literally 2 minutes away and they have great restaurants like Cheesecake Factory and Morton's there. That's my honest opinion of TGIF in. Hackensack.
